item.title: Linea has approved to allocate 4% of LINEA to participating Linea Surge liquidity providers.
item.description: On September 3rd, the Linea Association announced in a tweet, "The Linea Association has granted approval for the allocation of 4% of LINEA to the liquidity providers who have participated in the Linea Surge event. As the initial step of the distribution, SBT was issued to the eligible wallets last Friday. More detailed information regarding the conversion of these SBT into LINEA tokens will be announced through the official qualification check page."

item.title: A Whale Suspected of Dumping 2585 ETH, Profits Reach $5.33 Million
item.description: September 3rd. As per on-chain analyst Ai Yi (@ai_9684xtpa), a significant whale transferred the 2,585 ETH that had been accumulated over the past four months to Binance around 10 hours ago (approximately equivalent to $11.32 million USD), suggesting a possible liquidation. In the event of a sale, the return on investment over the four-month period would be approximately 89%. With an entry price of $2,316 and an exit price of $4,378, the whale's total gains from engaging in the practice of buying low and selling high over four months amount to $5.33 million USD.

item.title: The probability on Polymarket of "Trump Leaving Office This Year" has dropped to 7%, after Trump appeared in a live-streamed White House press briefing.
item.description: On September 3rd, based on the information on the relevant page, the probability on Polymarket that "Trump steps down as president this year" is currently 7%.Previously, it was reported that during a White House press conference, Trump appeared on live camera, dispelling speculation about his health. In the first half of today's White House press conference, live broadcasts from major U.S. media outlets such as Fox News, NBC, CNBC, etc. showed the exterior of the White House without featuring Trump's live image at the press conference venue. When asked about the "rumors of his death," Trump replied, "Didn't see it."

item.title: Tom Lee's Fund Analyst: ETH Could Surge to $5,500 in September and $9,000 by January Next Year
item.description: On September 3rd, the Chairman of BitMine, Tom Lee, stated in the company's latest "Chairman's Address" video that he sought the technical analysis of Ethereum from his in-house fund analyst, Mark Newton.Mark Newton said: "ETH may reach approximately $5,500 in September and is projected to rise to $9,000 by January of next year."

item.title: Trader Eugene: Went Long on SOL with a Small Position
item.description: On September 3rd, trader Eugene Ng Ah Sio posted on his personal channel and said, "Initiated a small attempt at taking a long position in SOL."BTC has successfully regained the $110,000 level and is currently the strongest among the mainstream coins at present. Therefore, I decided to enter. With ETH losing its upward momentum and mNAVs contracting (with BMNR currently being less than 1.1 and SBET being less than 1), I anticipate that market funds will flow into those newer and lighter-weighted coins.If BTC falls below $110,000, I will make a quick adjustment or exit the position.

item.title: House Appropriations Committee Republican Chair Pushes to Delay Stopgap Funding Bill to November
item.description: September 3rd. According to foreign media reports, Tom Cole, the chairman of the House Appropriations Committee, stated on Tuesday that he is advocating for a stopgap measure to postpone the government shutdown threat to November this month in order to gain time for funding negotiations. Congress now must reach an agreement by September 30th to maintain government funding; otherwise, it will face the risk of the first shutdown in years. When asked about his preferred timeline for the stopgap measure, Cole said that he would prefer a "to November" stopgap measure, freezing funding at the current level while lawmakers negotiate the 2026 fiscal year bill. Cole further stated that lawmakers are specifically discussing pushing the deadline to at least November 6th, but he added, "We will at the latest before Thanksgiving, such as the 20th." (FXStreet)

item.title: SOL/ETH exchange rate has risen to 0.04845, with a 24-hour increase of 5.25%.
item.description: On September 3rd, based on HTX market data, with SOL briefly breaking through $210, the SOL/ETH exchange rate rose to 0.04845 and achieved a 24-hour gain of 5.25%.

item.title: A certain whale/institution has been withdrawing 42,682 ETH from OKX since August 29th.
item.description: On September 3rd, as monitored by on-chain analyst Wu Jinyan, since August 29th, the whale/institution that has been withdrawing a significant amount of ETH from OKX has re-withdrawn another 5,100 ETH (approximately $22.02 million) through the same address just 45 minutes ago.Since August 29th, this whale/institution has cumulatively withdrawn 42,682 ETH (approximately $188 million) from OKX through 3 addresses within five days, with an average price of $4,403. Additionally, the address also holds 80.8 million USDT that was withdrawn from OKX in July.

item.title: A whale has sold 15,555 SOL to swap for HYPE and currently holds 352,913 HYPE.
item.description: On September 3rd, as per the monitoring of LookOnChain, Whale 5oMWCZ once more deposited 15,555 SOL ($3.24 million) into Hyperliquid. After selling it, it purchased HYPE.The whale currently holds 352,913 HYPE tokens ($15.77 million), with an unrealized profit of $1.5 million.

item.title: In the past week, 500,000 ETH were withdrawn from the exchange platform.
item.description: On September 3rd, the cryptocurrency analyst @ali_charts disclosed on-chain data indicating that in the previous week, 500,000 ETH were withdrawn from exchanges, with a total value of approximately $2.1 billion.
